metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6690 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: python-gnupg 0.4.3 allows context-dependent attackers to trick gnupg todecrypt other ciphertext than intended. To perform the attack, thepassphrase to gnupg must be controlled by the adversary and the ciphertextshould be trusted. Related to a "CWE-20: Improper Input Validation" issueaffecting the affect functionality component.

criterions.comment: python-gnupg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
